item.title: Laurence Juber
item.itunes:author: Michael Pursche
item.description:
Sitting in a bar in Adelaide

Laurence Juber

Laurence is one of the worlds most celebrated
guitarists, but maybe not a household name...

His latest project is with the music for one
of the worlds most popular computer games-
Diable III.
But Laurence has made 20 solo albums and
played countless sessions.
But most well know for his time
as a member of Wings with Paul McCartney.
The 1979 LP Back to the Egg still stands up
as one of the best Wings albums

we chat about al that and more...

item.description:
Sitting in a bar in Adelaide

Jim Paterson of The BordererS

The BordererS are an Adelaide
institution, Jim & Alex

and play to their fans
around the world.

1 - Tales of Love And Loss

A fund raiser is on June 9 in Adelaide
at the Prospect Community Hall.

I chat to Jim about all things BordererS !

item.description:
Sitting in a bar in Adelaide

Rick Brewster

'Brothers, Angels & Demons'
at the Adelaide Caberet Festival-
The Brewster Brothers present a flashback journey
through their four musical decades together.
They’ll strap on the washboards to reveal their
musical partnership beginnings with The
Moonshine Jug and String Band, perform the
most famous hit songs of The Angels and will
bring you safely back to the present with songs as The Brewster Brothers.

June 16 & 17

item.title: RIP Vince Lovegrove
item.itunes:author: Michael Pursche
item.description:
Sitting in a bar in Adelaide

RIP Vince Lovegrove

Australian music legend Vince Lovegrove, who passed away
 tragically in a car accident.

Originally from Western Australia, Lovegrove was rock & roll
 through and through, having performed with Bon Scott in 60's band The Valentines.
He move to Adelaide in 1970 working as a rock music journalist
 and later introducing Bon to AC/DC,he also managed Cold Chiseland The Divinyls.

item.title: Roosevelt Radio
item.itunes:author: Michael Pursche
item.description:
Sitting in a bar in Adelaide

My guests this week from
Roosevelt Radio, a great new band out of
Sanfrancisco.
Their new EP 'Dream Of Demolition'
features five songs recorded with producer
Sean Beresford at Third Eye Blind's private
studio in San Francisco. It is a high energy
rock n' roll record drenched in strong melodies
and dusted with with electro and prog-ish elements.

 

and I play Shark Attack from Split Enz
as i was recently a guest on
Maurice Bursztynski's
'Love that album' podcast
discussing 'True Colors'
http://lovethatalbum.podbean.com/mf/web/gqdg4g/LoveThatAlbumE13.mp3

item.title: RESURGENCE OF ROCK” BLANCAWHITE
item.itunes:author: Michael Pursche
item.description:
Sitting in a bar in Adelaide

Ken Savage

Ken and producer Austin Schell release -
RESURGENCE OF ROCK” BLANCAWHITE’S DEBUT ALBUM,

It’s high time for a resurgence of classic hard rock!
 With that rallying cry, BlancaWhite has released its
debut, full-length album, “Resurgence of Rock,” to
significant fanfare and acclaim. Sung by legendary
vocalists from the 70s and 80s hard rock era
Paul Shortino (Quiet Riot, King Kobra, Rough Cut)
Lorraine Lewis (Femme Fatale, LA Nookie)
Terry Ilous (XYZ, Great White),
Jeff Paris (Slash, Cinderella, Keb Mo)-
Resurgence of Rock is original, in-your-face,
party-hardy hard rock at its finest!

Check out Maurice Bursztynski's
podcast 'Love that Album'
http://lovethatalbum.blogspot.com/
this week im the guest on the show
and we discuss my favorite Tubes LP
'Remote Control'

The IceHaloes, also play a tune from them.

talk about the new CD soon.

'Sticky Fingers'.
The  guys have a great new EP out called
"Happy Endings" & the band will also be on the
show soon to tell us about the EP
and their upcoming visit to Adelaide
at the end of Feb.

item.title: Sitting in a bar in Adelaide - The Trews
item.itunes:author: Michael Pursche
item.description:
Sitting in a bar in Adelaide - The Trews

Canada’s premier rock outfit
brings their unique sound back to Australia

Acclaimed Canadian rock band The Trews
 are thrilled to announce that they wil
l once again grace Australian shores for
a run of dates through NSW, SA, VIC and QLD
 this September and October.

The Trews wowed Australian audiences with their
 dynamic live shows earlier this year, when they
 played a string of packed out residencies in Sydney
 and Melbourne. East Coast music lovers were shown
 exactly why The Trews are one of Canada’s premier
 live music acts, with the band delivering show
after show of flawless rock.

The four-piece outfit released their fourth
 studio album “Hope & Ruin”

item.title: Sitting in a bar in Adelaide - Tex Perkins
item.itunes:author: Michael Pursche
item.description:
Sitting in a bar in Adelaide - Tex Perkins

Frontman for The Cruel Sea and the hard edged pub
rock of The Beasts of Bourbon,
 collaborator on the Tex, Don and Charlie outings,
and compadre to Tim Rogers on the TnT project.
 More recently seen leading the
Tennessee Four in a night of memorable music
in his turn in the Johnny Cash
musical The Man In Black, Tex is now back once again to the lilting,
 dark country of
Tex Perkins & The Dark Horses,
returning this coming June with a new album and to
play some select tour dates in support.

So come and join Tex Perkins and fellow Dark Horses - Charlie Owen, Joel
Silbersher and two new members, bassist Steve Hadley and drummer Gus Agars–
 as they come together to help celebrate the
release of the self-titled album “Tex Perkins & The Dark Horses”

item.title: Georgia Germein
item.itunes:author: Michael Pursche
item.description:
Sitting in a bar in Adelaide

Georgia Germein

Georgia Germein is an Australian, Adelaide based acoustic pop

singer-songwriter who is already achieving an extensive amount for someone

so young in their musical career.

Her unique style blends the exuberance of pop with an acoustic earthy

texture, topping it off with the ringing purity and precision of her vocal

delivery. Drawing on her experiences of growing up in the bush in the

Adelaide Hills, her love of the ocean and travelling, combined with her

commitment to the Environment, Indigenous Reconciliation, her work in the

Kalahari, South Africa and Nepal as World Vision's 2010 Youth Ambassador,

Georgia is a promise of extraordinary things coming your way.

adelaiderockshow@gmail.com

item.title: Dave Gleeson with Rick Brewsters Angels
item.itunes:author: Michael Pursche
item.description:
Sitting in a bar in Adelaide

Dave Gleeson

At a recent Brewster Brothers show in his home city of Adelaide, old friend and fellow Oz-rock legend, Dave Gleeson from The Screaming Jets joined the Brewsters on stage for an impromptu performance where he belted out classics such as “Take A Long Line”, “No Secrets”, “Marseilles” and “Am I Ever Gonna See Your Face Again?” Needless to say fans were blown away by Dave’s powerhouse vocals.

Since then, Dave Gleeson (Screaming Jets) has entered the studio to collaborate with Rick Brewster, John Brewster and Chris Bailey from The Angels on a couple of new songs they’d been working on. Gleeson's voice not only suits all the old Angels classics but has reignited a passion for writing new music. Stay tuned for the new tracks, guaranteed to please all die-hard fans


email the show
adelaiderockshow@gmail.com

item.title: Skipping Girl Vinegar
item.itunes:author: Michael Pursche
item.description:
Sitting in a Bar in Adelaide

Skipping Girl Vinegar


Keep Calm, Carry The Monkey is the second offering
from up-and-coming indie darlings Skipping Girl Vinegar [SGV]
A beautifully diverse album; rich with sonic landscapes, melodies, and

lyrical turns, every returned listen unravels new layers. Keep Calm, Carry

The Monkey breaks wide open the pop revelation the band hinted at on their

critically acclaimed debut Sift the Noise and will surely impress and

propel the band to their highly deserved next level.

item.title: Catherine Traicos
item.itunes:author: Michael Pursche
item.description:
Sitting in a bar in Adelaide

Catherine Traicos

Sydney singer-songwriter Catherine Traicos’ ability to combine surprising

arrangements, her gorgeously delicate smoky voice and brilliant live

performances have seen her compared to everyone from Gillian Welch, Cat

Power and Beth Orton to eels and Cowboy Junkies.

Catherine’s new album, “Gloriosa”, produced by 5 time ARIA award

winner,Paul McKercher and recorded for the first time with her full band,

the Starry Night.
